/* American individualist anarchism */ modifications. this section should be more about similarities than differences. It's supposed to be about the things that influences ancap, not the differences.
It was a post to an online forum, I know because I was there at the time and watched a friend participate in the discussion. Please don't resort to an online forum for a source

it says exactly what peacott said now, since you want to hide that he thinks ancaps are individualist anarchists. and don't remove Garner source. it's from Ifeminist Newsletter.

Peacott does not say this in the article, it is an interpretation, and one that is contradicted in the article that follows, which itself is being improperly interpreted

Removing this quote, as it shows no particular similarity between individualists and anarcho-capitalists, given that all anarchists believe "taxation" and protection, if they exist, must be voluntary
